skill.name: dotnet-backend-patterns
skill.description: Master C#/.NET backend development patterns for building robust APIs, MCP servers, and enterprise applications. Covers async/await, dependency injection, Entity Framework Core, Dapper, configuration, caching, and testing with xUnit. Use when developing .NET backends, reviewing C# code, or designing API architectures.
skill.summary: Master C#/.NET backend development patterns for building robust APIs, MCP servers, and enterprise ap...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found. The repository contains documentation and C# templates without file system access or command execution.

content.value_statement: You need clear patterns for reliable .NET backends. This skill provides templates and guidance for architecture, data access, caching, and testing.
actual_capabilities: Explain clean architecture project structure for .NET services
Detail dependency injection lifetimes, options, and keyed services
Provide async and Result pattern examples with cancellation tokens
Show caching and validation flow in a service template
Outline Dapper repository patterns and query building
Summarize EF Core performance best practices
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Does not provide deployment or hosting automation
Does not access databases or external services

use_cases.title: Plan a new API
use_cases.description: Define layers, dependency injection setup, and async patterns for a new .NET Web API.

use_cases.title: Review data access
use_cases.description: Evaluate Dapper or EF Core usage for correctness, performance, and maintainability.

use_cases.title: Strengthen tests
use_cases.description: Identify test targets and patterns for unit and integration testing with xUnit.

prompt_templates.title: Start with structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a clean architecture layout and DI registrations for a small .NET 8 product API.

prompt_templates.title: Tune EF Core
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this EF Core query and suggest performance fixes like tracking, projections, and indexing.

prompt_templates.title: Design Dapper repo
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a Dapper repository method for paged search with count, parameters, and cancellation token.

prompt_templates.title: Add caching plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a memory plus Redis caching strategy with invalidation rules for product updates.

output_examples.input: Outline a Dapper search method with pagination and total count
output: Use QueryMultiple to fetch total count and page results in one round trip
Build WHERE clauses with parameters to avoid SQL injection
Apply OFFSET and FETCH for pagination with page size limits
Return items and total count as a tuple or result object

best_practices: Use async methods with cancellation tokens end to end
Validate inputs at boundaries before data access
Choose EF Core or Dapper based on workload needs
anti_patterns: Blocking on async calls with Result or Wait

faq.question: Is it compatible with .NET 8?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets .NET 8 and recent LTS versions.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and templates only. It does not run code or access data.

faq.question: Can I integrate it with an existing solution?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the patterns to refactor services and repositories incrementally.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. The content is static and does not read files or transmit data.

faq.question: What if the guidance does not fit my stack?
faq.answer: Ask for alternatives. The patterns can be adapted to your constraints.

faq.question: How does it compare to general coding skills?
faq.answer: It focuses on .NET backend patterns, EF Core, Dapper, DI, caching, and testing.
